description: Number of runs in base 10 representation of n.
comments: Blecksmith, Filaseta, & Nicol show that lim a(k^n) = infinity whenever k is not a power of 10. More generally, in base b, the limit is infinity exactly when log k/log b is irrational. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 29 2014
links: Richard Blecksmith, Michael Filaseta, and Charles Nicol, A result on the digits of a^n, Acta Arithmetica 64 (1993), pp. 331-339.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
